title: Leona is OP?
body:
According to champion.gg, she has a 56% win rate now. I'm not saying she needs nerfs. It's nice to see someone other than Soraka doing well as support. But I'm wondering what made her so good all of a sudden. As far as I know, she hasn't received any buffs for a long time.

http://champion.gg/statistics/#?sortBy=general.winPercent&order=descend

replies.body:
We've identified a few things that we believe have helped Leona out quite a bit in 6.13:

* XP changes. She's one of the more XP dependent supports, so increased XP access really helps her out.
* Changes that should have been in 6.14 that shipped early. Specifically, the root on E going to 0.5s from 0.25s and bonus attack range from Q going to 50 from 30. Edit: Looks like the Q stun got changed to 1.25s instead of the 1.0s it had always been too (tooltip was wrong). That's just outright bugged (not intended in 6.14 either) and will also add noticeable power. 
* More good targets bot lane for her. Leona does well against squishy enchanter type supports and we've seen some increases in play rate for some of those in 6.13. 

We've still got changes coming in 6.14 for her. Original intent of those changes was power neutral, given some of the buffs shipped without any of the nerfs would expect 6.14 to make her weaker than in 6.13. Not certain if that'll necessarily put her in the right spot or not though, systemic changes do seem to have been pretty kind to her, will need to keep an eye on how she does.
